Sentencas: Assembling multiple perovskites with complementary properties is a promising strategy to achieve high-performance cathodes for low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell (LT/IT-SOFC).
Titulo: Rational design of the self-assembled BaCo1-xZrxO3-δ (x=0.8-0.2) nanocomposites as the promising low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: In this work, self-assembling perovskites of cubic BaZr0.82Co0.18O3-delta (cub-BZC) and hexagonal BaCo0.96Zr0.04O2.6+delta (12H-BC) at the nanoscale can be realized in novel designed nanocomposites with nominal composition of BaCo1-xZrxO3-delta(x = 0.8-0.2), which can possess congenital compatibility, improved thermal expansion coefficients and electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Rational design of the self-assembled BaCo1-xZrxO3-δ (x=0.8-0.2) nanocomposites as the promising low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: The relative contents of cubic and hexagonal phases are significantly correlated with the zirconium content (x).
Titulo: Rational design of the self-assembled BaCo1-xZrxO3-δ (x=0.8-0.2) nanocomposites as the promising low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Therein, BaCo1-xZrxO3-delta nanocomposites exhibit relatively low content differences among pemvskite phases when x = 0.4 (cubic/hexagonal = 62:38) and x = 0.2 (hexagonal/cubic = 69:31) nanocomposites, which can form more extensive heteminterfaces for promoting oxygen adsorption, dissociation and reduction reaction.
Titulo: Rational design of the self-assembled BaCo1-xZrxO3-δ (x=0.8-0.2) nanocomposites as the promising low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: When further applied as cathode, the cell with BaCo1-xZrxO3-delta nanocomposites achieve 2265-598 mW cm(-2) (800-600 degrees C) when x = 0.2 as a promising IT-SOFC cathode, and 315-148 mW cm(-2) (550-500 degrees C) when x = 0.4 as a promising LT-SOFC cathode.
Titulo: Rational design of the self-assembled BaCo1-xZrxO3-δ (x=0.8-0.2) nanocomposites as the promising low/intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathodes
